question_text: In a load-balanced redundant power supply setup, what happens if one power supply fails?
answer_options: The second power supply takes on 100% of the load
Power is reduced to all non-critical components
correct_answer: The second power supply takes on 100% of the load
explanation: In load-balanced redundancy, each power supply shares half the load during normal operation. If one fails, the other seamlessly handles the full load.
